item.title: Sample and Population Parameters
item.description: A population of interest consists of every data point in a...well... "population". For example, say you want to figure out if a certain product is popular (by a "rating" variable) among 20 to 30 year old males living in the United Kingdom. Your population in this case is all males aged 20 to 30 years living in the United Kingdom. Assume (for simplicity) that every body in the population has rated the product.
